artworks.title: Netherlandish Proverbs - "One shears sheep, the other shears pigs" (One has all the advantages, the other none)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Feel the hens" (Count your chickens before they hatch)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Puts the blue cloak on her husband" (Cuckolds)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Hangs the cloak according to the wind" (Adapts viewpoint to current opinion)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Can't bear to see the sun shining on the water" (Jealous of another's success)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "One winds on the distaff what the other spins" (Spreads gossip)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Bang your head against a brick wall" (Attempt the impossible)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "Hold an eel by the tail" (Undertake a difficult task. Today: 'catch a tiger by the tail')
Netherlandish Proverbs - "To fall from the ox onto the rear end of an ass" (To fall on hard times)
Netherlandish Proverbs - "To lead each other by the nose" (To fool each other)
